samples.question: Do you prefer on, shopping alone or with someone else?

Yeah, like 90% of the time I buy stuff online. Because you know, all the, I think these days online shopping malls are really convenient. And it is, I think it is faster and, and it is nothing, I think it is, I think it is better than actual, like, you actually going to the store because you can see many brands and, you know, at the same time. So I think it is really time-saving. Yeah, I think. So what happened here is something that happens actually pretty regularly in the IELTS test. And it makes it look like the examiner is not listening. Because David had to ask a question that Maren had already answered. But the thing is, the examiner has a set list of questions. they are not inventing them as they ask them. they are taking them from a special booklet produced by Cambridge. So whether the information has already been given or not, the examiner is still going to ask the next question. So if you think that is a little bit weird, well, it is. But you still just have to answer and say something like, well, as I said, and as Maren did, try to add some extra information to this answer. Okay, well in the next part of the test I am going to give you a topic and I would like you to speak for one to two minutes.

samples.question: And how do you think communication with parents has changed over the years?
samples.transcript: I guess maybe because of all the social media and all the internet things. specifically teenagers, they do not, really try to talk to their parents a lot because they are so, like, focused into their, online, like, internet life. They, they prefer talking to their online friends rather than talking to actual friends or families. So, yeah, I think as people started to think, like you are, you are living your life for yourself, communication also has become more difficult, I guess, within your own families or close friends. Okay, so this is the second question in a row, and we can see that Maren is really starting to struggle with what she should say. Now, the impression that I am getting is that Maren has lots of ideas coming at her, but she does not know which ones to discuss. So what I would recommend for Maren here is to just begin by deciding on a clear, simple answer to the question. So she might want to begin by saying, communication has become worse. Communication has become less common. Or something very simple. And then for the rest of her answer, she would just expand and explain that point. So instead of speaking and kind of coming back to the answer later, start with a clear, simple answer. Once you have that done, you can just explain it and develop on that further. Okay.

samples.question: Do you usually celebrate your birthdays?
samples.transcript: Yes, I do. But I usually have two birthday parties for my birthday, one for my family and one for my friends. And I actually enjoy my birthday party with my friends because they prepare me a lot of presents and they usually do like surprise events. So it really makes me happy. But also I really enjoy having birthday parties with my family because, you know, it is my family. So yeah. Nice.

samples.question: Do you think people take care of their parents as much these days as they did in the past?
samples.transcript: I think, well let me talk about the Japanese culture, because I am most familiar with Japanese culture. I think in the past it was more like, as as you graduate from the universities you need to go to work and you need to take care of your parents as soon as you start earning your own money. But like these days, not only in Japan, but I think it is a universal thing, but I think people started to live for themselves rather than, for their parents. So, for, I also, I, I also think that I should live for myself rather than me earning money for my parents. Because well, it is my life and my life is not just about taking care of my parents just because they took care of me for the past few, ten years, ten or twenty years. So, yeah, compared to the past, I think individualism is really like popular these days.
samples.transcript_original: Hmm. I think, um, well let me talk about the Japanese culture, because I'm most familiar with Japanese culture. So, yeah, compared to the past, um, I think individualism is really like popular these days.

samples.question: What happens to children when their parents are too strict?
samples.transcript: Well, for that, I would like to mention about the Asian culture. I think, well, it is a little bit, stereotypical, but Asian parents tend to make their children, study hard for, so that they can get into good universities. And therefore they get into good, big, you know, corporations or companies. But I think looking at the recent data, there are many teenagers committing suicide because their parents are like too, too focused on their education rather than their like personal lives. So I think if the parents are too strict on their children, It really affects them mentally and also physically. And I feel like it kind of influences their personalities also. So, yeah.
